definition: to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to break out into a cold sweat (idiom)
to act as a go between
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
to break out into a cold sweat (idiom)
to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
form of therapeutic massage, mainly for children, in which a roll of skin is squeezed, working from the base of the spine to the neck (TCM)
lit. it's the soft persimmons that people choose to squeeze (idiom)/fig. it's the weak (i.e. 軟柿子|软柿子[ruan3 shi4 zi5]) who get picked on/bullies pick soft targets
pinyin: shi4 zi5 tiao1 ruan3 de5 nie1

sentences.english: The only time its okay to use your fingers is when it's a fish bone.
sentences.chinese: 只有在吃鱼的时候，才可以用手去捏鱼骨头。

sentences.english: With integral manual override, tubing is pinched closed in de-energized state.
sentences.chinese: 随着积分手动装置，油管是捏在封闭状态断电。

sentences.english: If you combine all that effort into one, you should have a lot more effect.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把它们都捏到一块儿，你就会有大得多的影响。

sentences.english: He opened his eyes and via his tears looked over at the circle of string he still held clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他睁开眼睛，透过泪水看向他依然捏在手里的绳圈。

sentences.english: Dough is kneaded and then molded into little cute animals by this folk artisan.
sentences.chinese: 民间艺人搓捏为一个个可爱的小动物。

sentences.english: It makes sense to stick to materials that squish in a child’s hand.
sentences.chinese: 坚持使用孩子捏在手里会发出叫声的材料是合理的。

sentences.english: Shall I be the one for you who pinches you softly but sure.
sentences.chinese: 我可以这样做吗？轻轻地捏你一下。

sentences.english: The Qin Dynasty holds chin, turning brain to looking at ghost will fix Luo.
sentences.chinese: 秦朝捏着下巴，回头看着鬼将修罗。
他的捏拧擦伤了桃子的表面。

sentences.english: He opened his eyes and through his tears looked over at the circle of string he still held clutched in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 他睁开眼睛，透过泪水看向他依然捏在手里的绳圈。

sentences.english: Today, trying to be cute, my boyfriend threw a snowball at me.
sentences.chinese: 今天男友卖萌捏了一个雪球朝我砸过来。

sentences.english: This time I'm holding a oneway ticket to the big nothing.
sentences.chinese: 这次我手里捏着的是一张单程票。

sentences.english: Then she smiled and squeezed my hand.
sentences.chinese: 针打完后，她微笑着捏了捏我的手。

sentences.english: Then she smiled and squeezed my hand.
sentences.chinese: 针打完后，她微笑着捏了捏我的手。

sentences.english: Your job is to do your job, not to be a pushover.
sentences.chinese: 工作就是工作，别做一只任人捏的软柿子。

sentences.english: My Pikachu grins happily when I pinch its cheek.
sentences.chinese: 我的皮卡丘高兴地笑当我捏其脸颊。

definition: to pick (flowers)/to pinch/to nip/to pinch off/to clutch/(slang) to fight
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
palm (of one's hand)/control (extended meaning from having something in the palm of one's hand)
to rub or roll between the hands or fingers/to twist
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
